intro: Eriospermum veratriforme, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, globular flower heads that resemble small globes, which are composed of numerous tiny, tubular flowers. The plant has hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with toothed margins. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open plains. Eriospermum veratriforme is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
